ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He created man from dry earth like baked clay;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He created man of fermented clay dried tinkling hard like earthen ware,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He has created man from dry, rotten clay like the potter's,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He created the human being from clay like that used for pottery
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He created man from clay like that of earthenware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He created man from sounding clay like the clay of pottery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He created man from dry clay like earthen vessels,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He created man of a clay like the potter's,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He created man of clay like the potter's,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He has created man, from dry ringing clay, like the potter"s,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He created man of clay like, Unto pottery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He created man out of dry clay, like the potter’s,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He created man (Adam) from sounding clay like the clay of pottery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He created the human from clay, like earthenware
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He created man from hard clay, like bricks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:14] He created man, Adam, of dry clay (salsāl, a dry hollow mud producing an echo if tapped), resembling the potter’s (fakhkhār, clay that has been baked),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He created man) i.e. Adam (of clay like the potter's) out of which pottery is made,
